tweets.text: @fayedavies @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids No whitewashing should be endured and no more soothing words and empty promises. @RedIndustries2 has to do more than the bare minimum and play their role as a genuine part of the community. No more lip service. #StopTheStink @DaveJonesNuL @CllrTonyK @AFH7_fbu @CllrStubbsNUL https://t.co/iIGyYCCOC2

Day Nine.
The pollution is STILL emanating from Furness Vale Marina, stretching over a mile to New Mills. The boom at Bridge 29 isn't working and the polluting waste oil is just as bad as it was a week ago. Why is the slick still not being stopped at Bridge 30? @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/9lxlWtbhQe

@StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @DaveJonesNuL The EA cannot record accurately, cannot monitor,cannot regulate,cannot communicate,cannot control,cannot get their story straight! But what they can do is just allow the unreasonable stench/air pollution to substantially interfere with people‚Äôs life & healthü§Æ#statutorynuisance

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @DaveJonesNuL  Can someone explain this? There was no drilling at the weekend. Then why did the EA say that there was? Why were they using this as an excuse for the most complained about smell in the UK? https://t.co/PYLM7c2yiY

***FREE ACCESS TO THIS PAPER FOR 2 WEEKS*** 
A timely commentary paper on the limitations of the concept of #SoilHealth and suggestions on how to derive a more useful approach for #soil management.
https://t.co/ORb5FTqOMd
@PBaveye @wileyearthspace @ejsoilscience @Soil_Science

Last week our Lower Hull Field Team deployed a floating retention boom in the Broomfleet area.

They have been working with our Environment Management Team and have deployed the booms to contain a kerosene spill so it does not move further downstream. https://t.co/iExZ1I6Gmj
Fantastic news, river diversion works at the Victoria Ground in Stoke are progressing well. #StaffsSunrise. @EnvAgencyMids @StaffsWildlife @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/BwYxGSdJSp

tweets.text: Just getting started.  Hello @EnvAgencySE ! Hello @EnvAgency
@EnvAgency Imagine monitoring a really stinky landfill site's omissions and not having your equipment plugged in all weekend.  What an embarrassing situation. #walleysquarry #redindustries #capitoff

Wet wipes, sanitary towels and bits of plastic bags polluting the River Lea at Hackney Marshes. How many have flowed down the river in recent weeks? Much harder to deal with then litter on dry land. https://t.co/milBIRS3rZ

@StinkStopthe @scottdegg @NewsNBC @EnvAgency Currently heaving, feel so sick with the stench in my property from that disgusting landfilled  now mountain of garbage, headache, can't breathe properly, won't sleep tonight, still have to work tomorrow, this is unbearable.maybe we all need sick note from docs, horrendous,
#stopthestink #capitoff retweet, tag, share. Get the word out. @NewsNBC @EnvAgency https://t.co/PNu5iIMcQX

@SimonTagg @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids A Westerly wind tonight... Pray for Knutton, Poolfields, Clayton, the Town Centre, Hartshill, Basford... shameful... @JamesBevanEA How long can this continue? The headaches, the nausea... ü§Æü§Æ  @PHE_uk @BBCWatchdog #capitoff https://t.co/uDf78V4oGk

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @Kamron09 @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive You don‚Äôt need a monitoring unit, it is blatantly obvious and the town should be evacuated

@EnvAgencyMids @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive @BBCWatchdog there is a human story to be told in Newcastle Under Lyme. Residents quality of life is suffering... The tools available within the current framework do nothing in resolving this prolonged issue...

@EnvAgencyMids @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive Residents of Newcastle under Lyme, yet again, this morning, woke up to the vile horrendous stench that emits from Whalleys quarry into their homes.
People are becoming frustrated as this has been going on for far too long & is getting worse.

@EnvAgencyMids @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive Whether the air quality is acceptable or not...it stinks. Regardless of results something needs to be done. We may finally have a summer out of lockdown, we would like to be able to sit in our gardens.
